summary.long: Luke is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Many have undertaken to compile an account of the events that have been fulfilled among us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: an account like those handed down to us by those who were eyewitnesses and ministers of the word from the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason, it seemed good to me also, since I followed everything closely from the beginning, to write an orderly account to you, most excellent Theophilus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you may know the certainty of the things you were taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the days of Herod, king of Judea, there was a certain priest named Zechariah, who belonged to the priestly division of Abijah. His wife was from the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were both righteous before God, walking blamelessly in all the commandments and righteous decrees of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did not have a child because Elizabeth was unable to bear children, and they were both well along in years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On one occasion, while Zechariah was serving as priest before God and his division was on duty,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he was chosen by lot, according to the custom of the priesthood, to go into the temple of the Lord and burn incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole crowd of people were praying outside the temple during the hour of the incense offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An angel of the Lord appeared to him, standing on the right side of the altar of incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Zechariah saw him, he was startled and overcome by fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the angel said to him, “Do not be afraid, Zechariah, because your prayer has been heard. Your wife Elizabeth will bear a son for you, and you are to name him John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will have joy and gladness, and many will rejoice at his birth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he will be great in the sight of the Lord. He is never to drink wine or beer. He will be filled with the Holy Spirit, even from his mother’s womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will turn many of the sons of Israel back to the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will go before him in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children, to turn the disobedient to the wisdom of the righteous, to prepare a people who are ready for the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zechariah said to the angel, “How can I be sure of this, because I am an old man, and my wife is well along in years?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel answered him, “I am Gabriel. I stand in the presence of God and was sent to speak to you in order to tell you this good news.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now listen, you will be silent and unable to speak until the day when these things happen, because you did not believe my words, which will be fulfilled at the proper time.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, the people were waiting for Zechariah and wondering what was taking him so long in the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he did come out, he was unable to speak to them. Then they realized that he had seen a vision in the temple. He kept making signs to them and remained unable to speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the days of his priestly service were completed, he went back to his home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After those days his wife Elizabeth conceived. She kept herself in seclusion for five months, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord has done this for me in the days when he looked with favor on me and took away my disgrace among the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the sixth month, the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a town of Galilee named Nazareth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to a virgin pledged in marriage to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David. The virgin’s name was Mary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel went to her and said, “Greetings, you who are highly favored! The Lord is with you. Blessed are you among women.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But she was greatly troubled by the statement and was wondering what kind of greeting this could be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel said to her, “Do not be afraid, Mary, because you have found favor with God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Listen, you will conceive and give birth to a son, and you are to name him Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will be great and will be called the Son of the Most High. The Lord God will give him the throne of his father David.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He will reign over the house of Jacob forever, and his kingdom will never end.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary said to the angel, “How will this be, since I am a virgin?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel answered her, “The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you. So the holy one to be born will be called the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Listen, Elizabeth, your relative, has also conceived a son in her old age even though she was called barren, and this is her sixth month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nothing will be impossible for God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Mary said, “See, I am the Lord’s servant. May it happen to me as you have said.” Then the angel left her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days Mary got up and hurried to the hill country, to a town of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She entered the home of Zechariah and greeted Elizabeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as Elizabeth heard Mary’s greeting, the baby leaped in her womb, and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She called out with a loud voice and said, “Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But why am I so favored that the mother of my Lord should come to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, just now, as soon as the sound of your greeting reached my ears, the baby in my womb leaped for joy!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is she who believed, because the promises spoken to her from the Lord will be fulfilled!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Mary said,
My soul proclaims the greatness of the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and my spirit has rejoiced in God my Savior,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because he has looked with favor on the humble state of his servant.
Surely, from now on all generations will call me blessed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because the Mighty One has done great things for me, and holy is
    his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His mercy is for those who fear him from generation to generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has shown strength with his arm.
He has scattered those who were proud in the thoughts of their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has brought down rulers from their thrones.
He has lifted up the lowly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has filled the hungry with good things, but the rich he has sent
    away empty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has come to the aid of his servant Israel, remembering his mercy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as he spoke to our fathers, to Abraham and his offspring forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary stayed with Elizabeth about three months and then returned to her home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the time came for Elizabeth to have her baby, she gave birth to a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her neighbors and relatives heard that the Lord had shown her great mercy, and they were rejoicing with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eighth day they came to circumcise the child. They wanted to call him Zechariah after the name of the father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his mother answered, “No. He will be called John.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to her, “There is no one among your relatives who is called by this name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made signs to his father, to see what he wanted to name him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked for a writing tablet and wrote, “His name is John.” And they were all amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately Zechariah’s mouth was opened, his tongue was loosed, and he began to speak, praising God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear came on all who lived around them. In the entire hill country of Judea people were talking about all these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And everyone who heard this took it to heart, saying, “What then will this child be?” Clearly, the hand of the Lord was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His father Zechariah was filled with the Holy Spirit and prophesied:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the Lord, the God of Israel,
because he has visited us and prepared redemption for his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has raised up a horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as he said long ago through the mouth of his holy prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He raised up salvation from our enemies and from the hand of all who hate us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order to show mercy to our fathers by remembering his holy covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the oath which he swore to Abraham our father,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to grant deliverance to us from the hand of our enemies,
so that we are able to serve him without fear,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in holiness and righteousness before him all our days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And you, child, will be called a prophet of the Most High,
because you will go before the Lord to prepare his ways,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to give his people the knowledge of salvation by the forgiveness of their sins,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because of God’s tender mercies,
by which the Rising Sun from on high will visit us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to shine on those who sit in darkness and in the shadow of death,
to guide our feet into the way of peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The child continued to grow and became strong in spirit. He lived in the wilderness until the day of his public appearance to Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days a decree went out from Caesar Augustus that all the world should be registered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the first census taken while Quirinius was governing Syria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And everyone went to register, each to his own town.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the town of Nazareth, into Judea, to the town of David, which is called Bethlehem, because he was from the house and family line of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went to be registered with Mary, his wife, who was pledged to him in marriage and was expecting a child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so it was that while they were there, the time came for her to give birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she gave birth to her firstborn son, wrapped him in swaddling cloths, and laid him in a manger, because there was no room for them in the inn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were in the same country shepherds staying out in the fields, keeping watch over their flock at night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An angel of the Lord appeared to them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were terrified!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the angel said to them, “Do not be afraid. For behold, I bring you good news of great joy, which will be for all people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today in the town of David, a Savior was born for you. He is Christ the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this will be a sign for you: You will find a baby wrapped in swaddling cloths and lying in a manger.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, there was with the angel a multitude from the heavenly army, praising God and saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Glory to God in the highest, and on earth peace, good will toward mankind.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the angels went away from them into heaven, the shepherds said to one another, “Now let’s go to Bethlehem and see this thing that has happened, which the Lord has made known to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they hurried off and found Mary and Joseph, and the baby, who was lying in the manger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had seen him, they told others the message they had been told about this child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all who heard it were amazed by what the shepherds said to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Mary treasured up all these things, pondering them in her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen, which were just as they had been told.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After eight days passed, when the child was circumcised, he was named Jesus, the name given by the angel before he was conceived in the womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the time came for their purification according to the law of Moses, they brought him up to Jerusalem to present him to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (As it is written in the law of the Lord, “Every firstborn male will be called holy to the Lord.”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to offer a sacrifice according to what was said in the law of the Lord, “A pair of turtledoves or two young pigeons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a man in Jerusalem whose name was Simeon. This man was righteous and devout, waiting for the comfort of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he would not see death before he had seen the Lord’s Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moved by the Spirit he went into the temple courts. When the parents brought in the child Jesus to do for him what was customary according to the law,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simeon took him into his arms and praised God. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, you now dismiss your servant in peace, according to
    your word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because my eyes have seen your salvation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which you have prepared before the face of all people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a light for revelation to the Gentiles, and the glory of your
    people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph and the child’s mother were amazed at the things that were spoken about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simeon blessed them and said to Mary his mother, “Listen carefully, this child is appointed for the falling and rising of many in Israel and for a sign that is spoken against,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed. And a sword will pierce your own soul too.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anna, a prophetess, was there. She was a daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher. She was very old. She had lived with her husband for seven years after her marriage,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and then she was a widow of eighty-four years. She did not leave the temple complex, since she was worshipping with fasting and prayers night and day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Standing nearby at that very hour, she gave thanks to the Lord. She kept speaking about the child to all who were waiting for the redemption of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had accomplished everything according to the law of the Lord, they returned to Galilee, to their own town, Nazareth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The child grew and became strong. He was filled with wisdom, and God’s favor was on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every year his parents traveled to Jerusalem for the Passover Festival.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he was twelve years old, they went up according to the custom of the Festival.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the days had ended, as they were returning, the boy Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem. His parents did not know it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since they thought he was in their group, they went a day’s journey. Then they began to look for him among their relatives and friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they did not find him, they returned to Jerusalem, searching for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After three days they found him in the temple courts, sitting among the teachers, listening to them and asking them questions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all who heard him were amazed at his understanding and his answers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When his parents saw him, they were astonished. His mother said to him, “Son, why have you treated us this way? See, your father and I have been anxiously looking for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Why were you looking for me? Did you not know that I must be taking care of my Father’s business?”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: They did not understand what he was telling them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went down with them and came to Nazareth. He was always obedient to them. And his mother treasured up all these things in her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus grew in wisdom and stature, and in favor with God and with people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar—while Pontius Pilate was governor of Judea, Herod was tetrarch of Galilee, his brother Philip was tetrarch of the region of Ituraea and Trachonitis, and Lysanias was tetrarch of Abilene—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: during the high priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, the word of God came to John, the son of Zechariah, in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went into the whole region around the Jordan, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Just as it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet:
A voice of one calling in the wilderness,
“Prepare the way of the Lord! Make his paths straight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every valley will be filled, and every mountain and hill will be
    made low.
The crooked will become straight, and the rough ways smooth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And everyone will see the salvation of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So John kept saying to the crowds who came out to be baptized by him, “You offspring of vipers, who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore produce fruits in keeping with repentance! Do not even think of saying to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father,’ because I tell you that God is able to raise up children for Abraham from these stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even now the ax is ready to strike the root of the trees. So every tree that does not produce good fruit is going to be cut down and thrown into the fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowds began to ask him, “What should we do then?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “Whoever has two shirts should share with the person who has none, and whoever has food should do the same.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tax collectors also came to be baptized. They said, “Teacher, what should we do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To them he said, “Collect no more than what you were authorized to.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Soldiers were also asking him, “And what should we do?”
He told them, “Do not extort money from anyone by force or false accusation. Be satisfied with your wages.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people were waiting expectantly and were all wondering in their hearts if John might be the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered them all, “I baptize you with water. But someone mightier than I is coming. I am not worthy to untie the strap of his sandals. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His winnowing shovel is in his hand, and he will thoroughly clean out his threshing floor. He will gather the wheat into his barn, but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then with many other words, he appealed to them and was preaching good news to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after John rebuked Herod the tetrarch because of Herodias, his brother’s wife, and because of all the evil things he had done—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod added this to them all: He locked John in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the people were being baptized, Jesus was baptized too. While he was praying, heaven was opened,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Holy Spirit descended on him in bodily form like a dove. And a voice came from heaven: “You are my Son, whom I love. I am well pleased with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus himself was about thirty years old when he began his ministry.
Jesus was the son (so it was thought) of Joseph, the son of Heli,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melchi, the son of Jannai, the son of Joseph,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Mattathias, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Esli, the son of Naggai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Maath, the son of Mattathias, the son of Semein, the son of Josech, the son of Joda,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Joanan, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, the son of Neri,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Melchi, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmadam, the son of Er,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Joshua, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Simeon, the son of Judah, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonam, the son of Eliakim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Melea, the son of Menna, the son of Mattatha, the son of Nathan, the son of David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Salmon, the son of Nahshon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Amminadab, the son of Ram, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez, the son of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Nahor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Eber, the son of Shelah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Malaleel, the son of Cainan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the son of Enos, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan and was led by the Spirit in the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: where he was tempted by the Devil for forty days. He did not eat anything during those days. When they came to an end, he was hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Devil said to him, “If you are the Son of God, tell this stone to become bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “It is written: ‘Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The Devil led him up to a high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Devil told him, “I will give you all this power and the glory of these kingdoms, because it has been entrusted to me, and I can give it to anyone I want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, if you worship me, it will all be yours.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “It is written: ‘You shall worship the Lord your God and serve him only.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The Devil led him to Jerusalem and had him stand on the pinnacle of the temple. “If you are the Son of God,” he said, “throw yourself down from here,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because it is written:
He will command his angels concerning you, to protect you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And,
they will lift you up with their hands,
so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “It says: ‘You shall not test the Lord your God.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When the Devil had finished every temptation, he left him until an opportune time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus returned to Galilee in the power of the Spirit, and news about him spread through all the surrounding area.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was teaching in their synagogues and being honored by everyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went to Nazareth, where he had been brought up. As was his custom, he went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day and stood up to read.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The scroll of the prophet Isaiah was handed to him. He unrolled the scroll and found the place where it was written:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Spirit of the Lord is on me,
because he anointed me to preach good news to the poor.
He has sent me to proclaim freedom to the captives
and recovery of sight to the blind,
to set free those who are oppressed,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: and to proclaim the year of the Lord’s favor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He rolled up the scroll, gave it back to the attendant, and sat down. The eyes of everyone in the synagogue were fastened on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He began to tell them, “Today, this Scripture is fulfilled in your hearing.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: They all spoke well of him and were impressed by the words of grace that came from his mouth. And they kept saying, “Isn’t this Joseph’s son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “Certainly you will quote this proverb to me, ‘Physician, heal yourself!’ Do here in your hometown everything we heard you did in Capernaum.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he said, “Amen I tell you: No prophet is accepted in his hometown.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But truly I tell you: There were many widows in Israel in the days of Elijah, when the sky was shut for three years and six months, while a great famine came over all the land.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Elijah was not sent to any of them, but to a widow of Zarephath, in Sidon.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And there were many lepers in Israel in the time of Elisha the prophet, yet not one of them was healed except Naaman the Syrian.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: All those who were in the synagogue were filled with rage when they heard these things.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: They got up and drove him out of the town. They led him to the brow of the hill on which their town was built, in order to throw him off the cliff.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he passed through the middle of them and went on his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went down to Capernaum, a town of Galilee, and was teaching them on the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were amazed by his teaching, because his message had authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the synagogue there was a man who was possessed by the unclean spirit of a demon. He cried out with a loud voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Leave us alone! What do you have to do with us, Jesus the Nazarene? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are: the Holy One of God!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be silent, and come out of him!” The demon threw him down in front of them and came out of him without harming him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: They were all filled with awe and began to say to one another, “What is this message? With authority and power he commands unclean spirits, and they come out!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: News about him spread to every place in the surrounding area.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus got up, left the synagogue, and went into Simon’s house. Simon’s mother-in-law was suffering from a high fever. They asked him to help her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He stood over her, rebuked the fever, and it left her. Immediately she got up and began to serve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the sun was setting, they brought to him all who were sick with various diseases. He laid his hands on every one of them and healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Demons also came out of many people, crying out, “You are the Son of God!” He rebuked them and did not allow them to speak, because they knew that he was the Christ.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When it was day, he went out to a deserted place. The crowds were looking for him. They went up to him and were trying to prevent him from leaving them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he told them, “I must preach the good news of the kingdom of God to the other towns too, because that is why I was sent.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And he continued to preach in the synagogues in the land of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One time, while the crowd was pressing in on Jesus and listening to the word of God, he was standing by the Lake of Gennesaret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He saw two boats there along the lakeshore. The fishermen had left them and were washing their nets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus got into one of the boats, which belonged to Simon, and asked him to put out a little from the shore. He sat down and began teaching the crowds from the boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had finished speaking, he said to Simon, “Put out into the deep water, and let down your nets for a catch.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon answered him, “Master, we worked hard all through the night and caught nothing. But at your word I will let down the nets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had done this, they caught a great number of fish, and their nets were about to tear apart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They signaled their partners in the other boat to come and help them. They came and filled both boats, so that they began to sink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Simon Peter saw this, he fell down at Jesus’ knees, saying, “Go away from me, because I am a sinful man, Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Peter and all those with him were amazed at the number of fish they had caught,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and so were James and John, the sons of Zebedee, who were partners with Simon.
Jesus said to Simon, “Have no fear. From now on you will be catching people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they brought their boats to the shore, they left everything and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On another occasion, Jesus was in one of the towns, and there was a man full of leprosy. When he saw Jesus, he fell on his face and begged him, “Lord, if you are willing, you can make me clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus stretched out his hand and touched him. “I am willing,” he said. “Be made clean.”
Immediately the leprosy left him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus ordered him to tell no one, “But go, show yourself to the priest, and offer what Moses commanded for your cleansing, as a testimony for them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The news about him spread even more, and large crowds gathered to listen and be healed of their sicknesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus often withdrew to deserted places and prayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On one of the days while Jesus was teaching, Pharisees and teachers of the law were sitting there who had come from every village of Galilee and Judea and from Jerusalem. The power of the Lord was with him to heal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just then, men who were carrying a paralyzed man on a stretcher tried to bring him in and lay him in front of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since they did not find a way to bring him in because of the crowd, they went up on the roof and lowered him down through the tiles on his stretcher into the middle of the crowd, right in front of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw their faith, he said, “Man, your sins have been forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The experts in the law and the Pharisees began to think to themselves, “Who is this fellow who speaks blasphemies? Who can forgive sins except God alone?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus knew their thoughts and answered them, “Why are you thinking this in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which is easier: to say, ‘Your sins have been forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up and walk’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins. . .” He said to the paralyzed man, “I tell you, get up, take your stretcher, and go home.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately, he stood up in front of them, picked up what he had been lying on, and went home glorifying God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were all astonished and glorified God. They were also filled with reverence and said, “We have seen wonderful things today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things, Jesus went out and saw a tax collector by the name of Levi sitting at the tax collector’s booth. He said to him, “Follow me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Levi left everything, got up, and followed Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Levi gave a great banquet for him in his house. There was a large crowd of tax collectors and others dining with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees and experts in the law grumbled against his disciples, saying, “Why do you eat and drink with tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “The healthy do not need a physician, but the sick do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “Why do John’s disciples fast and pray often, and so do the Pharisees’ disciples, but yours go on eating and drinking?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “You cannot make the attendants of the bridegroom fast while the bridegroom is with them, can you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them. Then, in those days, they will fast.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them a parable: “No one tears a patch from a new garment and puts it on an old garment. If he does, he will tear the new garment, and the patch from the new garment will not match the old one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no one pours new wine into old wineskins. If he does, the new wine will burst the skins, it will be spilled, and the skins will be ruined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, new wine must be put into fresh wineskins so both are preserved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no one wants new wine while drinking old wine, because he says, ‘The old is fine.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus was going through the grain fields on a Sabbath day, his disciples were picking heads of grain, rubbing them in their hands, and eating them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of the Pharisees said, “Why are you doing what is not lawful on the Sabbath?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Haven’t you read what David did when he was hungry (he and his companions)?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went into the house of God, took and ate the Bread of the Presence, which is lawful only for the priests to eat. He also gave some to his companions.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus also said to them, “The Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On another Sabbath he went into the synagogue and taught. A man was there whose right hand was withered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The experts in the law and the Pharisees were watching him closely, to see if he would heal on the Sabbath. They wanted to find a reason to accuse him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he always knew their thoughts. He said to the man with the withered hand, “Stand up and step forward.” He got up and stood there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “I will ask you something. Is it lawful on the Sabbath to do good or to do evil, to save life or to destroy it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He looked around at all of them and told the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He did, and his hand was restored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were filled with rage and began discussing with one another what they could do to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It happened in those days that Jesus went up on the mountain to pray, and he spent all night in prayer to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was day, he summoned his disciples and chose twelve of them, whom he also called apostles:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon, whom he also named Peter, and his brother Andrew; James and John; Philip and Bartholomew;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Matthew and Thomas; James the son of Alphaeus, also Simon, who was called the Zealot;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas the son of James, and Judas Iscariot, who became a traitor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went down with them and stood on a level place with a large crowd of his disciples and a large number of people from all Judea and Jerusalem, as well as from the coastal area of Tyre and Sidon. These people came to listen to him and to be healed of their diseases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who were troubled by unclean spirits were also cured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole crowd kept trying to touch him, because power was going out from him and healing them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He lifted up his eyes to his disciples and said:
Blessed are you who are poor,
    because yours is the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are you who hunger now,
    because you will be satisfied.
Blessed are you who weep now,
    because you will laugh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are you whenever people hate you,
and whenever they exclude and insult you
and reject your name as evil because of the Son of Man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Rejoice in that day and leap for joy because of this: Your reward is great in heaven! The fact is, their fathers constantly did the same things to the prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But woe to you who are rich,
    because you are receiving your comfort now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to you who are well fed now,
    because you will be hungry.
Woe to you who laugh now,
    because you will be mourning and weeping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to you when all people speak well of you,
    because that is how their fathers constantly treated the
        false prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But I say to you who are listening: Love your enemies. Do good to those who hate you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bless those who curse you. Pray for those who mistreat you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If someone strikes you on one cheek, offer the other too. If someone takes away your coat, do not withhold your shirt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give to everyone who asks you, and if anyone takes away your things, do not demand them back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Treat others just as you would want them to treat you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you love those who love you, what credit is that to you? To be sure, even the sinners love those who love them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you do good to those who do good to you, what credit is that to you? Even the sinners do the same thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you lend to those from whom you expect to be repaid, what credit is that to you? Even the sinners lend to sinners in order to be paid back in full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, love your enemies, do good and lend, expecting nothing in return. Your reward will be great, and you will be sons of the Most High, because he is kind to the unthankful and the evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be merciful, just as your Father is merciful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not judge, and you will not be judged. Do not condemn, and you will not be condemned. Forgive, and you will be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give, and it will be given to you. A good measure pressed down, shaken together, and running over will be poured into your lap. In fact, the measure with which you measure will be measured back to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also told them a parable: “A blind man cannot guide a blind man, can he? Won’t they both fall into a pit?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A disciple is not above his teacher, but everyone who is fully trained will be like his teacher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you look at the speck in your brother’s eye, but fail to notice the beam in your own eye?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or how can you tell your brother, ‘Brother, let me remove the speck in your eye,’ when you do not see the beam in your own eye? Hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye, and then you will see clearly to remove the speck in your brother’s eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Certainly a good tree does not produce bad fruit, and a bad tree does not produce good fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, each tree is known by its own fruit. For people do not gather figs from thorn bushes, and they do not gather grapes from a bramble bush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The good person brings what is good out of the good stored in his heart, and the evil person brings what is evil out of the evil within. To be sure, what his mouth speaks flows from the heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do you call me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ and do not do what I say?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who comes to me and listens to my words and does them—I will show you what he is like:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is like a man building a house who dug down deep and laid a foundation on bedrock. When a flood came, the river beat against that house but could not shake it, because it was founded on bedrock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who listened to my words and did not do them is like a man who built a house on the ground without a foundation. When the river broke against it, it fell immediately, and that house was completely destroyed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus had finished saying all these things to the people who were listening, he went into Capernaum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A centurion’s servant, who was valuable to him, was sick and about to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the centurion heard about Jesus, he sent some elders of the Jews to him, asking him to come and heal his servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to Jesus, they begged him earnestly, saying, “He is worthy of having you do this for him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he loves our nation, and he built our synagogue for us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went with them. When he was not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to tell Jesus, “Lord, do not trouble yourself, because I do not deserve to have you come under my roof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is why I did not consider myself worthy to come to you. But say the word, and my servant will be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am also a man placed under authority, having soldiers under me. I say to this one, ‘Go!’ and he goes; and to another one, ‘Come!’ and he comes; and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard these things, he was amazed at him. He turned to the crowd that was following him and said, “I tell you, I have not found such great faith, not even in Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the men who had been sent returned to the house, they found the servant well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Soon afterward Jesus went on his way to a town called Nain, and his disciples and a large crowd were traveling with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was approaching the town gate, there was a dead man being carried out, the only son of his mother. She was a widow, and a considerable crowd from the town was with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her and said to her, “Do not cry.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went up to the open coffin, touched it, and the pallbearers stopped. He said, “Young man, I say to you, get up!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The dead man sat up and began to speak, and Jesus gave him to his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fear gripped all of them, and they glorified God, saying, “A great prophet has arisen among us” and “God has visited his people!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was reported about him in all of Judea and in all the surrounding countryside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John’s disciples told him about all these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Calling two of his disciples to him, he sent them to Jesus to ask, “Are you the one who was to come or should we look for someone else?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the men had arrived, they said to Jesus, “John the Baptist sent us to ask you, ‘Are you the one who was to come or should we look for someone else?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Jesus healed many people of their diseases, afflictions, and evil spirits. And he gave many blind people the ability to see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Go, tell John what you have seen and heard: The blind receive their sight, the lame walk, the lepers are healed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, and the good news is preached to the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is the one who does not fall away on account of me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After John’s messengers had left, Jesus began to talk to the crowds about John: “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No. Then what did you go out to see? A man dressed in soft clothing? Yet those who are dressed in splendid clothing and live in luxury are in royal palaces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and much more than a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the one about whom it is written: ‘Look, I am sending my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare your way before you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yes, I tell you, among those born of women there is no prophet greater than John. Yet the one who is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the people (including the tax collectors) heard this, they declared that God was just, since they were baptized with the baptism of John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees and the legal experts rejected God’s purpose for themselves by not being baptized by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “To what then will I compare the people of this generation? What are they like?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are like children sitting in the marketplace and calling to one another, ‘We played the flute for you, and you did not dance. We sang a dirge, and you did not weep.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John the Baptist has come without eating bread or drinking wine, and you say, ‘He has a demon.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man has come eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Look, a man who is a glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet wisdom is declared right by all her children.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A certain one of the Pharisees asked Jesus to eat with him. Jesus entered the Pharisee’s house and reclined at the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just then a sinful woman from that town learned that he was reclining in the Pharisee’s house. She brought an alabaster jar of perfume,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: stood behind him near his feet weeping, and began to wet his feet with her tears. Then she began to wipe them with her hair while also kissing his feet and anointing them with the perfume.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Pharisee who had invited him saw this, he said to himself, “If this man were a prophet, he would realize who is touching him and what kind of woman she is, because she is a sinner.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus answered him, “Simon, I have something to tell you.”
He said, “Teacher, say it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A certain moneylender had two debtors. The one owed five hundred denarii, and the other fifty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they could not pay, he forgave them both. So, which of them will love him more?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Simon answered, “I suppose the one who had the larger debt forgiven.”
Then he told him, “You have judged correctly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Turning toward the woman, he said to Simon, “Do you see this woman? I entered your house, but you did not give me water for my feet. Yet she has wet my feet with her tears and wiped them with her hair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You did not give me a kiss, but she, from the time I entered, has not stopped kissing my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You did not anoint my head with oil, but she has anointed my feet with perfume.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I tell you, her many sins have been forgiven; that is why she loved so much. But the one who is forgiven little loves little.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to her, “Your sins have been forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those reclining at the table with him began to say among themselves, “Who is this who even forgives sins?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you. Go in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Soon afterward Jesus was traveling from one town and village to another, preaching and proclaiming the good news of the kingdom of God. The Twelve were with him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and also some women who had been healed of evil spirits and diseases: Mary, called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joanna, the wife of Cuza, Herod’s household manager; Susanna; and many others who provided support for them out of their own possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a large crowd was gathering and people from one town after another were making their way to him, he spoke using a parable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A sower went out to sow his seed. As he sowed, some fell along the path. It was trampled, and the birds of the sky devoured it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other seed fell on rocky ground. As soon as it grew, it withered away, because it had no moisture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other seed fell among thorns. The thorns grew up with it and choked it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other seed fell into good soil. It grew and produced fruit—one hundred times as much as was sown.” As he said these things, he called out, “Whoever has ears to hear, let him hear!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples asked him, “What does this parable mean?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “To you it has been given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God, but to the rest I speak in parables so that ‘even though they see, they may not see, and even though they hear, they may not understand.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the meaning of the parable: The seed is the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those along the path are the ones who hear it, but then the Devil comes and takes away the word from their hearts to keep them from believing and being saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those on the rocky ground are the ones who, when they hear, receive the word with joy, but they have no root. So they believe for a while, but then fall away in a time of testing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seeds that fell into the thorns are the ones who hear the word, but as they go on their way they are choked by the worries, riches, and pleasures of life, so they do not mature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the seeds in the good ground are the ones who hear the word with an honest and good heart, hold on to it tightly, and produce fruit as they patiently endure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one lights a lamp and then hides it under a jar or puts it under a bed. Instead, he puts it on a stand so that those who enter may see the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For nothing is hidden that will not be revealed, and nothing is secret that will not be made known and come to light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So listen carefully, because whoever has will be given more, and whoever does not have, even what he thinks he has will be taken away from him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus’ mother and brothers came to him, but they could not get near him because of the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Someone told him, “Your mother and brothers are standing outside, wanting to see you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered them, “My mother and brothers are those who are hearing and doing the word of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day Jesus got into a boat with his disciples and told them, “Let’s go over to the other side of the lake.” So they set out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were sailing, he fell asleep. A powerful windstorm came down on the lake, the boat was filling up with water, and they were in danger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They went to him and woke him, saying, “Master, master, we’re going to die!”
He woke up, rebuked the wind and the raging waves, and they stopped. Then it was calm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to them, “Where is your faith?”
They were afraid and amazed and said to one another, “Who, then, is this, that he commands even the winds and the water, and they obey him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They sailed down to the region of the Gerasenes, which is across from Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus stepped ashore, a man from the town met him. He was possessed by demons and for a long time had not worn any clothes. He did not live in a house but in the tombs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw Jesus, he cried out, fell down before him, and said with a loud voice, “What do I have to do with you, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I beg you, don’t torment me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Jesus had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man. In fact, the unclean spirit had seized him many times. He was kept under guard, and although he was bound with chains and shackles, he would break the restraints and was driven by the demon into deserted places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus asked him, “What is your name?”
He said, “Legion,” because many demons had gone into him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were begging Jesus that he would not order them to go into the abyss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A herd of many pigs was feeding there on the mountain. The demons begged Jesus to let them go into the pigs, and he gave them permission.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The demons went out of the man and entered the pigs, and the herd rushed down the steep bank into the lake and drowned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When those who were feeding the pigs saw what happened, they ran away and reported it in the town and in the countryside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People went out to see what had happened. They came to Jesus and found the man from whom the demons had gone out, sitting at Jesus’ feet. He was clothed and in his right mind, and the people were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who saw it told them how the demon-possessed man was saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The whole crowd of people from the surrounding country of the Gerasenes asked Jesus to leave them, because they were gripped with great fear.
As Jesus got into the boat and started back,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the man from whom the demons had gone out begged to be with him. But Jesus sent him away, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Return to your home and tell how much God has done for you.” Then he went through the whole town proclaiming what Jesus had done for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus returned, the crowd welcomed him, because they were all waiting for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just then a man named Jairus arrived. He was a ruler of the synagogue. He fell down at Jesus’ feet and begged him to come to his house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because he had an only daughter who was about twelve years old and she was dying.
As he went, the crowds pressed tightly against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a woman who had a flow of blood for twelve years, yet although she had paid physicians all she had to live on, she could not be healed by anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She approached Jesus from behind and touched the fringe of his garment. Immediately her flow of blood stopped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And Jesus said, “Who touched me?”
As everyone was denying it, Peter and those with him said, “Master, the crowds are pressing in and crowding you, yet you say, ‘Who touched me?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Someone touched me, because I know that power has gone out from me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the woman saw that she did not escape his notice, she came trembling and fell down before Jesus. In the presence of all the people she told him why she had touched him and how she was healed immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to her, “Daughter, your faith has saved you. Go in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, someone came from the synagogue ruler’s house, saying, “Your daughter has died. Don’t trouble the Teacher anymore.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus heard it, he told Jairus, “Do not be afraid. Only believe, and she will be saved.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he came to the house, he did not let anyone enter, except Peter, John, James, and the child’s father and mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people were weeping and mourning for her, but he said, “Stop weeping, because she is not dead, but sleeping.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They laughed at him, knowing that she was dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he took her by the hand and called out, “Child, get up!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her spirit returned, and she immediately got up. He ordered that something be given to her to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her parents were amazed, but he instructed them not to tell anyone what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus called the Twelve together and gave them power and authority over all demons and to cure diseases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent them out to proclaim the kingdom of God and to heal the sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Take nothing for the journey—no staff, no bag, no bread, no money; and do not take two coats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whatever house you enter, stay there until you leave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they do not welcome you, when you leave that town, shake off the dust from your feet as a testimony against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out and went throughout the villages, proclaiming the good news and healing everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod the tetrarch heard about everything that was happening, and he was quite puzzled because some said that John had risen from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others said that Elijah had appeared, and still others that one of the ancient prophets had risen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Herod said, “I beheaded John, but who is this, about whom I hear such great things?” So he wanted to see him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles returned and told Jesus what they had done. He took them and withdrew privately to a town called Bethsaida.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the crowds found out, they followed him. He welcomed them and spoke to them about the kingdom of God. He also healed those who needed healing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the day began to draw to a close, the Twelve came and said to him, “Dismiss the crowd so that they can go to the surrounding villages and farms to find lodging and food, because we are in a deserted place here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he said to them, “You give them something to eat.”
“We have no more than five loaves and two fish,” they replied, “unless we go and buy food for all these people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
(There were about five thousand men.)
He said to his disciples, “Have them sit down in groups of about fifty each.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did so and got them all to sit down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus took the five loaves and the two fish, and, looking up to heaven, he blessed and broke them. Then he kept giving them to the disciples to set before the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all ate and were satisfied. And they picked up twelve basketfuls of the broken pieces that were left over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One time when Jesus was praying alone and the disciples were with him, he asked them, “Who do the crowds say that I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered, “‘John the Baptist,’ but others say, ‘Elijah,’ and others say, ‘one of the ancient prophets come back to life.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?”
And Peter answered, “The Christ of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave them a strict command not to tell this to anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “The Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders, chief priests, and experts in the law. He must be killed and be raised on the third day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to all of them, “If anyone wants to come after me, let him deny himself, take up his cross daily, and follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for my sake will save it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After all, what will it benefit a man if he gains the whole world, but destroys himself or is lost?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, whoever is ashamed of me and my words, the Son of Man will be ashamed of him when he comes in his glory, and the glory of the Father, and of the holy angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am telling you the truth: There are some standing here who will certainly not taste death until they see the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About eight days after he said these words, Jesus took Peter, John, and James and went up on the mountain to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was praying, the appearance of his face changed, and his clothing became dazzling white.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just then, two men, Moses and Elijah, were talking with him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They appeared in glory and were talking about his departure, which he was going to bring to fulfillment in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter and those with him were weighed down with sleep, but when they were completely awake, they saw his glory and the two men standing with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the men were leaving Jesus, Peter said to him, “Master, it is good for us to be here. Let’s make three tents: one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.” He did not realize what he was saying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was saying these things, a cloud came and overshadowed them. They were afraid as they went into the cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a voice came out of the cloud, saying, “This is my Son, whom I love. Listen to him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the voice had spoken, they found Jesus alone. They kept this secret and told no one in those days any of the things they had seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, after they had come down from the mountain, a large crowd met him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just then a man from the crowd called out, “Teacher, I beg you to look at my son, because he is my only child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, a spirit takes hold of him, and suddenly he screams. Then it throws him into convulsions so that he foams at the mouth. It hardly ever leaves him and constantly tortures him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I begged your disciples to drive it out, but they could not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “O unbelieving and perverse generation, how long will I be with you and put up with you? Bring your son here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the boy was approaching, the demon threw him down and shook him with convulsions. But Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, healed the boy, and gave him back to his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They were all astonished at the majesty of God.
While everyone was amazed at all the things Jesus was doing, he said to his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let these words sink into your ears and remember this: The Son of Man is going to be betrayed into the hands of men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they did not understand what he was saying. It was hidden from them so they did not grasp it. And they were afraid to ask him about this statement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An argument started among them about which of them would be the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since Jesus knew the thoughts of their hearts, he took a little child and had him stand next to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “Whoever receives this little child in my name receives me. And whoever receives me receives him who sent me. In fact, the one who is least among all of you is the one who is great.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John said in reply, “Master, we saw someone driving out demons in your name, and we tried to stop him, because he is not following you along with us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “Do not try to stop him, because whoever is not against you is for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the days were approaching for him to be taken up, Jesus was determined to go to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent messengers ahead of him. They went and entered a Samaritan village to make preparations for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the people did not welcome him, because he was determined to go to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When his disciples James and John saw this, they said, “Lord, do you want us to call down fire from heaven to consume them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he turned and rebuked them. “You don’t know what kind of spirit is influencing you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man did not come to destroy people’s souls, but to save them.” Then they went to another village.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they went on the way, a man said to him, “I will follow you wherever you go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Foxes have holes, and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to another man, “Follow me!”
But he said, “Lord, first let me go and bury my father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “Let the dead bury their own dead, but you go and proclaim the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another man also said, “I will follow you, Lord, but first let me say good-bye to those at my home.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “No one who puts his hand to the plow and looks back is fit for the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, the Lord appointed seventy-two others and sent them out two by two ahead of him to every town and place where he was about to go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “The harvest is plentiful, but the workers are few. So ask the Lord of the harvest to send out workers into his harvest field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go your way. Look, I am sending you out as lambs among wolves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not carry a money bag or traveler’s bag or sandals. Do not greet anyone along the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever you enter a house, first say, ‘Peace be to this house.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a peaceful person is there, your peace will rest on him, but if not, it will return to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remain in that same house, eating and drinking what they give you, because the worker is worthy of his pay. Do not keep moving from house to house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever you enter a town and they welcome you, eat what is set before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heal the sick who are in the town and tell them, ‘The kingdom of God has come near you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But whenever you enter a town and they do not welcome you, go out into its streets and say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Even the dust from your town that clings to our feet, we wipe off against you. Nevertheless know this: The kingdom of God has come near.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, it will be more bearable for Sodom on that day than for that town.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the miracles that were done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it will be more bearable for Tyre and Sidon in the judgment than for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, Capernaum, will you be lifted up to heaven? No, you will be brought down to hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever listens to you listens to me. Whoever rejects you rejects me. And whoever rejects me rejects the one who sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventy-two returned with joy, saying, “Lord, even the demons submit to us in your name!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “I was watching Satan fall like lightning from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, I have given you authority to trample on snakes and scorpions and over all the power of the enemy. And nothing will ever harm you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, do not rejoice that the spirits submit to you, but rejoice that your names have been written in heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that same hour, Jesus rejoiced in the Holy Spirit and said, “I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you have hidden these things from the wise and learned and have revealed them to little children. Yes, Father, because this was pleasing in your sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Everything was handed over to me by my Father. No one knows who the Son is except the Father, and no one knows who the Father is except the Son and anyone to whom the Son wants to reveal him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Turning to the disciples, he said privately, “Blessed are the eyes that see what you see!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, I tell you that many prophets and kings wanted to see the things that you are seeing, yet did not see them, and to hear the things that you are hearing, yet did not hear them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just then, an expert in the law stood up to test Jesus, saying, “Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What is written in the law?” he asked him. “What do you read there?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He replied, “Love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your strength, and with all your mind; and, love your neighbor as yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, “You have answered correctly. Do this, and you will live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he wanted to justify himself, so he asked Jesus, “And who is my neighbor?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “A man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho. He fell among robbers who stripped him, beat him, and went away, leaving him half dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It just so happened that a priest was going down that way. But when he saw the man, he passed by on the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, a Levite also happened to go there, but when he saw the man, he passed by on the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A Samaritan, as he traveled, came to where the man was. When he saw him, he felt sorry for the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went to him and bandaged his wounds, pouring oil and wine on them. He put him on his own animal, took him to an inn, and took care of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, when he left, he took out two denarii, gave them to the innkeeper, and said, ‘Take care of him. Whatever extra you spend, I will repay you when I return.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which of these three do you think acted like a neighbor to the man who fell among robbers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The one who showed mercy to him,” he replied.
Then Jesus told him, “Go and do likewise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they went on their way, Jesus came into a village, and a woman named Martha welcomed him into her home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She had a sister named Mary, who was sitting at the Lord’s feet and was listening to his word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Martha was distracted with all her serving. She came over and said, “Lord, don’t you care that my sister has left me to serve alone? Tell her to help me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord answered and told her, “Martha, Martha, you are worried and upset about many things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but one thing is needed. In fact, Mary has chosen that better part, which will not be taken away from her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On another occasion, Jesus was praying in a certain place. When he finished, one of his disciples said to him, “Lord, teach us to pray, just as John also taught his disciples.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “When you pray, say, ‘Our Father in heaven, hallowed be your name. Your kingdom come. Your will be done on earth as it is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give us each day our daily bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Forgive us our sins, as we also forgive everyone who sins against us. And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Suppose one of you has a friend, and you go to him at midnight and tell him, ‘Friend, lend me three loaves of bread,
verses.speaker: Narrator
