verses.text: because a friend of mine who is on a journey has come to me, and I do not have anything to set before him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the one inside replies, ‘Don’t bother me. The door is already locked, and my children and I are in bed. I can’t get up and give it to you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, even if he will not get up and give him anything because he is his friend, yet because of his bold persistence, he will get up and give him as much as he needs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I tell you, keep asking, and it will be given to you. Keep seeking, and you will find. Keep knocking, and it will be opened to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For everyone who asks receives. The one who seeks finds. And to the one who knocks, it will be opened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What father among you, if your son asks for bread, would give him a stone? Or if he asks for a fish, would give him a snake instead of a fish?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if he asks for an egg, would give him a scorpion?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you then, though you are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus drove out a demon, which was mute. After the demon had gone out, the man who had been mute spoke, and the crowds were amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of them said, “He drives out demons by Beelzebul, the ruler of the demons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others were testing him by demanding of him a sign from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he knew their thoughts and said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is destroyed. And a house divided against itself falls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If Satan is divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand? You say that I drive out demons by Beelzebul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I drive out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your sons drive them out? So they will be your judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet if I drive out demons by the finger of God, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When a strong man, fully armed, guards his own house, his possessions are safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when someone stronger attacks him and defeats him, he takes away that man’s full armor, in which he had trusted, and divides up his plunder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The one who is not with me is against me. The one who does not gather with me scatters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When an unclean spirit goes out of a man, it passes through waterless places, seeking rest, but does not find any. Then it says, ‘I will return to my house, the one I left.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it returns, it finds the house swept and put in order.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it goes and brings seven other spirits more evil than itself, and they go in and dwell there. The last condition of that man becomes worse than the first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was saying these things, a woman from the crowd raised her voice and said to him, “Blessed is the womb that carried you, and the breasts at which you nursed!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “Even more blessed are those who hear the word of God and keep it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the crowds were increasing, he began to say, “This generation is an evil generation. It is seeking a sign, but no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For just as Jonah became a sign to the Ninevites, so also the Son of Man will be to this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Queen of the South will rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation, and she will condemn them, because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon. But look, one greater than Solomon is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Nineveh will stand up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, because they repented at the preaching of Jonah. But look, one greater than Jonah is here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one lights a lamp and puts it in a hidden place or under a basket, but on a stand so that those who come in may see the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your eye is the lamp of the body. When your eye is good, your whole body is full of light. But when it is bad, your body is full of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, see to it that the light that is in you is not darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if your whole body is full of light, without any dark part, it will be completely full of light, as when a lamp shines on you with bright light.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus spoke, a Pharisee invited him to have a meal with him. He went in and reclined at the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Pharisee saw this, he was amazed that he did not first wash before the meal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to him, “Now you Pharisees clean the outside of the cup and dish, but inside you are full of greed and wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fools! Didn’t the one who made the outside also make the inside?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But give those things that are inside as a gift to the poor, and see, everything will be clean for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But woe to you Pharisees, because you give a tenth of mint and rue and every herb, but you neglect justice and the love of God. You should have done these things without neglecting the others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to you Pharisees, because you love the best seat in the synagogues and the greetings in the marketplaces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to you, because you are like unmarked graves, and people walk over them without realizing it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the legal experts answered him, “Teacher, by saying these things you are insulting us too.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said, “Woe to you legal experts too, because you load people down with burdens too difficult to carry, and you yourselves do not touch these burdens with one of your fingers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to you because you build monuments for the prophets, but your fathers killed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you are witnesses and agree with what your fathers did, because they killed them, and you build their monuments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason the wisdom of God also said, ‘I will send them prophets and apostles. Some of them they will kill and persecute,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that this generation may be held responsible for the blood of all the prophets that has been shed from the foundation of the world,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah, who was killed between the altar and the sanctuary.’ Yes, I tell you, it will be charged against this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to you legal experts, because you took away the key of knowledge. You yourselves did not enter, and you hindered those who were trying to enter.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he went away from there, the experts in the law and the Pharisees began to oppose him fiercely and to question him closely about many things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were plotting against him to trap him in something he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, when a crowd of many thousands gathered together so that they were trampling on one another, he began to speak first to his disciples: “Be on your guard against the yeast of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is nothing concealed that will not be revealed, or hidden that will not be made known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, whatever you have said in the dark will be heard in the light, and what you have whispered in the ear in the inner rooms will be proclaimed on the housetops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I tell you, my friends, do not be afraid of those who kill the body and after that are not able to do any more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will show you the one you should fear. Fear him who, after he has killed the body, has authority to throw it into hell. Yes, I tell you, fear him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Are not five sparrows sold for two small coins? And not one of them is forgotten in God’s sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why, even the very hairs of your head are all numbered. So stop being afraid. You are worth more than many sparrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I tell you, whoever confesses me before other people, the Son of Man will also confess him before the angels of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whoever denies me in the presence of other people will be denied in the presence of the angels of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven. But anyone who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they bring you before synagogues, rulers, and authorities, do not worry about how you will defend yourself, or what you will say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the Holy Spirit will teach you in that very hour what you should say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Someone from the crowd said to him, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “Man, who appointed me to be a judge or an arbitrator over you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “Watch out and be on guard against all greed, because a man’s life is not measured by how many possessions he has.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them a parable: “The land of a certain rich man produced very well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was thinking to himself, ‘What will I do, because I do not have anywhere to store my crops?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, ‘This is what I will do. I will pull down my barns and build bigger ones, and there I will store all my grain and goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will tell my soul, “Soul, you have many goods stored up for many years. Take it easy. Eat, drink, and be merry.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But God said to him, ‘You fool, this night your soul will be demanded from you. Now who will get what you have prepared?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “That is how it will be for anyone who stores up treasure for himself and is not rich toward God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to his disciples, “For that reason I tell you, stop worrying about your life, about what you will eat, or about your body, what you will wear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Certainly life is more than food, and the body is more than clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider the ravens: They do not sow or reap; they have no warehouse or barn; and yet God feeds them. How much more valuable are you than birds!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And who of you by worrying can add a single moment to his lifespan?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since you are not able to do this little thing, why do you worry about the rest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider how the wild flowers grow. They do not labor or spin. But I tell you, not even Solomon in all his glory was dressed like one of these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If this is how God clothes the grass in the field, which is alive today and tomorrow is thrown into the furnace, how much more will he clothe you, you of little faith?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not constantly chase after what you will eat or what you will drink. Do not be worried about it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To be sure, the nations of the world chase after all of these things, but your Father knows that you need them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, continue to seek the kingdom of God, and all these things will be added to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be afraid, little flock, because your Father is pleased to give you the kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sell your possessions and give to the needy. Provide money bags for yourselves that do not become old, a treasure in the heavens that will not fail, where no thief comes near and no moth destroys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be dressed, ready for service, and keep your lamps burning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be like people waiting for their master to return from a wedding banquet, so that when he comes and knocks they can immediately open the door for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed are those servants, whom the master will find watching when he comes. Amen I tell you: He will dress himself and have them recline at the table, and he will come and serve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if he comes in the second or third watch, they will be blessed if he finds them alert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But know this: If the master of the house had known at what hour the thief was coming, he would have watched and not allowed his house to be broken into.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You also be ready, because the Son of Man is coming at an hour when you are not expecting him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said, “Lord, are you telling this parable to us or to everybody?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “Who then is the faithful and wise manager, whom the master will put in charge of his servants to give them their food allowance at the proper time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed is that servant whom his master will find doing so when he comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I tell you: He will put him in charge of all his possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if that servant says in his heart, ‘My master is staying away for a long time.’ And he begins to beat the male and female servants, to eat and drink and become drunk,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the master of that servant will arrive on a day when he was not expected and at an hour that his servant does not know. The master will cut him in two and assign him a place with the unbelievers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That servant who knew his master’s will and did not prepare or act according to what his master wanted, will be punished severely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who did not know, and did something worthy of punishment, will be punished lightly. From everyone to whom much was given, much will be expected. From the one who was entrusted with much, much more will be asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I came to throw fire on the earth, and how I wish it were already ignited.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have a baptism to undergo, and how distressed I am until it is finished!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you think that I came to bring peace on the earth? No, I tell you, but rather division.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, from now on there will be five divided in one household: three against two, and two against three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will be divided: father against son, and son against father; mother against daughter, and daughter against mother; mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law, and daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also said to the crowds, “Whenever you see a cloud rising in the west, you immediately say that a rainstorm is coming, and so it happens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whenever a south wind blows, you say that it is going to be hot, and it happens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hypocrites! You know how to interpret the appearance of the earth and the sky, but how is it that you do not know how to interpret this present time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why don’t you judge for yourselves what is right?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, as you are going with your adversary to the magistrate, make an effort on the way to reach a settlement with him. Otherwise, he may drag you off to the judge, and the judge may hand you over to the officer, and the officer may throw you into prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, you will never get out of there until you have paid the last cent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time there were some present who told Jesus about the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacrifices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “Do you think that these Galileans were worse sinners than all the other Galileans because they suffered these things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, no. But unless you repent, you will all perish too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or those eighteen who were killed when the tower in Siloam fell on them—do you think that they were worse sinners than all the people living in Jerusalem?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, no. But unless you repent, you will all perish too.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them this parable: “A man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard. He came looking for fruit on it, but he did not find any.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to the gardener, ‘Look, for three years now I have come looking for fruit on this fig tree, and I have found none. Cut it down. Why even let it use up the soil?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the gardener replied to him, ‘Sir, leave it alone this year also, until I dig around it and put fertilizer on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it produces fruit next year, fine. But if not, then cut it down.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a woman was there who had a spirit that had disabled her for eighteen years. She was bent over and could not stand up straight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw her, he called her over and said, “Woman, you are freed from your disability.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He placed his hands on her, and immediately she stood up straight and began to glorify God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the ruler of the synagogue was indignant that Jesus had healed on the Sabbath. He said to the crowd in response, “There are six days to do work. So come to be healed on those days and not on the Sabbath day!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord answered him, “Hypocrites! Doesn’t each of you untie his ox or his donkey from the manger on the Sabbath and lead it to water?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here is this daughter of Abraham, whom Satan has bound for eighteen years! Shouldn’t she be set free from this bondage on the Sabbath day?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he said these things, all his adversaries were put to shame. But the entire crowd was rejoicing over all the glorious things he was doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus asked, “What is the kingdom of God like, and to what will I compare it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like a mustard seed, which a man took and planted in his garden. It grew and became a large tree, and the birds of the air nested in its branches.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he said, “To what will I compare the kingdom of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like yeast, which a woman took and mixed into a bushel of flour until it was all leavened.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went on his way from one town and village to another, teaching, and making his way to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Someone said to him, “Lord, are only a few going to be saved?”
He said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Strive to enter through the narrow door, because many, I tell you, will try to enter and will not be able.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once the master of the house gets up and shuts the door, you will begin to stand outside and knock on the door, saying, ‘Lord, open for us!’ He will tell you in reply, ‘I don’t know you or where you come from.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will begin to say, ‘We ate and drank in your presence, and you taught in our streets.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he will say, ‘I don’t know where you come from. Depart from me, all you evildoers.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth when you see Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and all the prophets in the kingdom of God, but you yourselves thrown outside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People will come from east and west, from north and south, and will recline at the table in the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And note this: Some are last who will be first, and some are first who will be last.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that very hour, some Pharisees came to him and said, “Leave, and go away from here, because Herod wants to kill you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Go tell that fox, ‘Look, I am going to drive out demons and heal people today and tomorrow, and on the third day I will reach my goal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, I must go on my way today and tomorrow and the next day, because it cannot be that a prophet would be killed outside Jerusalem!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Jerusalem, Jerusalem, the city that kills the prophets and stones those sent to her! How often I have wanted to gather your children together, as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you were not willing!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, your house is left to you desolate. I tell you, you will not see me until the time comes when you will say, ‘Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One Sabbath day, when Jesus went into the house of a leader of the Pharisees to eat bread, they were watching him closely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Right in front of him was a man who was suffering from swelling of his body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus addressed the legal experts and Pharisees, saying, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were silent. So he took hold of the man, healed him, and let him go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Which of you, if your son or an ox would fall into a well on a Sabbath day, would not immediately pull him out?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they could not reply to these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he noticed how they were selecting the places of honor, he told the invited guests a parable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you are invited by someone to a wedding banquet, do not recline in the place of honor, or perhaps someone more distinguished than you may have been invited by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who invited both of you may come and tell you, ‘Give this man your place.’ Then you will begin, with shame, to take the lowest place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when you are invited, go and recline in the lowest place, so that when the one who invited you comes, he will tell you, ‘Friend, move up to a higher place.’ Then you will have honor in the presence of all who are reclining at the table with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yes, everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also said to the one who had invited him, “When you make a dinner or a supper, do not invite your friends, or your brothers, or your relatives, or rich neighbors, so that perhaps they may also return the favor and pay you back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when you make a feast, invite the poor, the crippled, the lame, the blind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you will be blessed, because they cannot repay you. Certainly, you will be repaid in the resurrection of the righteous.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When one of those at the table with him heard these things, he said to Jesus, “Blessed is the one who will feast in the kingdom of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “A certain man made a great banquet and invited many people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was time for the banquet, he sent out his servant to tell those who were invited, ‘Come, because everything is now ready.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they all alike began to make excuses.
“The first one told him, ‘I bought a field, and I need to go and see it. I ask you to excuse me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Another one said, ‘I bought five yoke of oxen, and I am going to try them out. I ask you to excuse me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Still another said, ‘I just got married, and so I am unable to attend.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The servant arrived and reported these things to his master. Then the master of the house was angry and said to his servant, ‘Go out quickly into the streets and alleys of the town, and bring in here the poor, the crippled, the blind, and the lame.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The servant said, ‘Master, what you commanded has been done, and there is still room.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the master said to the servant, ‘Go out into the highways and hedges, and urge them to come in, so that my house may be filled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, I tell you that none of those men who were invited will taste my banquet.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Large crowds were traveling with Jesus. He turned and said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If anyone comes to me and does not hate his own father and mother, wife and children, brothers and sisters, yes, even his own life, he cannot be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever does not carry his own cross and follow me cannot be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For which of you, if he wants to build a tower, does not first sit down and count the cost to see if he has enough to complete it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise, when he has laid a foundation and is not able to finish, everyone who sees it will begin to ridicule him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, ‘This fellow began to build, but was not able to finish.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or what king, as he goes out to confront another king in war, will not first sit down and consider if he is able with ten thousand to oppose the one who comes against him with twenty thousand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he is not able, he sends out a delegation and asks for terms of peace while his opponent is still far away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, any one of you who does not say farewell to all his own possessions cannot be my disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salt is good, but if the salt has lost its flavor, how will it become salty again?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not fit for the soil or for the manure pile. It is thrown away. The one who has ears to hear, let him hear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the tax collectors and sinners were coming to Jesus to hear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees and the experts in the law were complaining, “This man welcomes sinners and eats with them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them this parable:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Which one of you, if you had one hundred sheep and lost one of them, would not leave the ninety-nine in the wilderness and go after the one that was lost until he finds it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he finds it, he joyfully puts it on his shoulders
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and goes home. Then he calls together his friends and his neighbors, telling them, ‘Rejoice with me, because I have found my lost sheep!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, in the same way there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous people who do not need to repent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Or what woman who has ten silver coins, if she loses one coin, would not light a lamp, sweep the house, and search carefully until she finds it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she finds it, she calls together her friends and neighbors and says, ‘Rejoice with me, because I have found the lost coin.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, I tell you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner who repents.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “A certain man had two sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The younger of them said to his father, ‘Father, give me my share of the estate.’ So he divided his property between them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not many days later, the younger son gathered together all that he had and traveled to a distant country. There he wasted his wealth with reckless living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he had spent everything, there was a severe famine in that country, and he began to be in need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went and hired himself out to one of the citizens of that country, who sent him into his fields to feed pigs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He would have liked to fill his stomach with the carob pods that the pigs were eating, but no one gave him anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When he came to his senses, he said, ‘How many of my father’s hired servants have more than enough bread, and I am dying from hunger!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will get up, go to my father, and tell him, “Father, I have sinned against heaven and in your sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am no longer worthy to be called your son. Make me like one of your hired servants.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He got up and went to his father. While he was still far away, his father saw him and was filled with compassion. He ran, hugged his son, and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and in your sight. I am no longer worthy to be called your son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But the father said to his servants, ‘Quick, bring out the best robe and put it on him. Put a ring on his finger and sandals on his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring the fattened calf and kill it. Let us eat and celebrate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because this son of mine was dead and is alive again. He was lost and is found.’ Then they began to celebrate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “His older son was in the field. As he approached the house, he heard music and dancing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called one of the servants and asked what was going on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servant told him, ‘Your brother is here! Your father killed the fattened calf, because he has received him back safe and sound.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The older brother was angry and refused to go in. His father came out and began to plead with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He answered his father, ‘Look, these many years I’ve been serving you, and I never disobeyed your command, but you never gave me even a young goat so that I could celebrate with my friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when this son of yours arrived after wasting your property with prostitutes, you killed the fattened calf for him!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The father said to him, ‘Son, you are always with me, and all that I have is yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it was fitting to celebrate and be glad, because this brother of yours was dead and is alive again. He was lost and is found.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus also said to his disciples, “There was a rich man who had a manager who was accused of wasting his possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rich man called him in and said to him, ‘What is this that I hear about you? Give an account of your management, because you can no longer be manager.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The manager said to himself, ‘What will I do, since my master is taking away the management position from me? I am not strong enough to dig. I am ashamed to beg.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know what I will do, so that when I am removed from my position as manager, people will receive me into their houses.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He called each one of his master’s debtors to him. He asked the first, ‘How much do you owe my master?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, ‘Six hundred gallons of olive oil.’ He said to him, ‘Take your bill, sit down quickly, and write three hundred.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to another, ‘How much do you owe?’ And he said, ‘Six hundred bushels of wheat.’ He said to him, ‘Take your bill and write four hundred and eighty.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The master commended the dishonest manager because he had acted shrewdly. For the children of this world are more shrewd in dealing with their own generation than the children of the light are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, make friends for yourselves with unrighteous mammon, so that when it runs out, they will welcome you into the eternal dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who is faithful with very little is also faithful with much. And the person who is unrighteous with very little is also unrighteous with much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if you have not been faithful with unrighteous mammon, who will entrust you with what is really valuable?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you have not been faithful with what belongs to someone else, who will give you something to be your own?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No servant can serve two masters. Indeed, either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve both God and mammon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees, who loved money, also heard all these things and sneered at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “You are the ones who justify yourselves in the sight of people, but God knows your hearts. In fact, what is highly regarded among people is an abomination in God’s sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Law and the Prophets were until John. Since that time the good news of the kingdom of God is proclaimed, and everyone is trying to force his way into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It is easier for heaven and earth to pass away than for even one part of a letter in the Law to fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who divorces his wife and marries another is committing adultery, and the man who marries a woman divorced from her husband is committing adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There was a rich man who was dressed in purple and fine linen, living in luxury every day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A beggar named Lazarus had been laid at his gate. Lazarus was covered with sores and
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: longed to be fed with what fell from the rich man’s table. Besides this, the dogs also came and licked his sores.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eventually the beggar died, and the angels carried him to Abraham’s side. The rich man also died and was buried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In hell, where he was in torment, he lifted up his eyes and saw Abraham far away and Lazarus at his side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called out and said, ‘Father Abraham, have mercy on me! Send Lazarus to dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue, because I am in misery in this flame.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But Abraham said, ‘Son, remember that in your lifetime you received your good things, and Lazarus received bad things. But now he is comforted here, and you are in misery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Besides all this, a great chasm has been set in place between us and you, so that those who want to cross from here to you cannot, nor can anyone cross over from there to us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He said, ‘Then I beg you, father, send him to my father’s home,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because I have five brothers—to warn them, so that they will not also come to this place of torment.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Abraham said, ‘They have Moses and the Prophets. Let them listen to them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘No, father Abraham,’ he said, ‘but if someone from the dead goes to them, they will repent.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Abraham replied to him, ‘If they do not listen to Moses and the Prophets, they will not be convinced even if someone rises from the dead.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to his disciples, “Temptations to sin are sure to come, but woe to the one through whom they come!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It would be better for that person if a millstone would be hung around his neck and he would be thrown into the sea than for him to cause one of these little ones to sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Watch yourselves.
“If your brother sins, rebuke him. If he repents, forgive him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if he sins against you seven times in a day, and seven times returns to you and says, ‘I repent,’ forgive him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles said to the Lord, “Increase our faith.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “If you had faith like a mustard seed, you could tell this mulberry tree, ‘Be uprooted and planted in the sea,’ and it would obey you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which one of you who has a servant plowing or taking care of sheep will say to him when he comes in from the field, ‘Come at once and recline at the table’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Won’t the master tell him instead, ‘Prepare my supper, and after you are properly dressed, serve me while I eat and drink. After that you may eat and drink’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He does not thank the servant because he did what he was commanded to do, does he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So also you, when you have done all that you were commanded, say, ‘We are unworthy servants. We have only done what we were supposed to do.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On another occasion, as Jesus was on his way to Jerusalem, he was passing along the border between Samaria and Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he entered a certain village, ten men with leprosy met him. Standing at a distance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they called out loudly, “Jesus, Master, have mercy on us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw them, he said, “Go, show yourselves to the priests.” As they went away they were cleansed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, glorifying God with a loud voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He fell on his face at Jesus’ feet, thanking him. And he was a Samaritan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus responded, “Were not ten cleansed? Where are the other nine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Was no one found to return and give glory to God except this foreigner?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to him, “Get up and go your way. Your faith has saved you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees asked Jesus when the kingdom of God would come. Jesus answered them, “The kingdom of God is not coming in a way you can observe,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor will people say, ‘Look, here it is!’ or ‘Look, there it is!’ because the kingdom of God is within you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the disciples, “The days will come when you will long to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you will not see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will tell you, ‘Look, there he is!’ or ‘Look, here he is!’ Do not go out or chase after them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the Son of Man in his day will be like the lightning that flashes and lights up the sky from one side to the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But first, he must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as it was in the days of Noah, so will it also be in the days of the Son of Man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were eating and drinking, marrying and being given in marriage, until the day when Noah entered the ark. Then the flood came and destroyed them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, just as it was in the days of Lot: They were eating and drinking, buying and selling, planting and building,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but on the day when Lot went out from Sodom, fire and sulfur rained down from heaven and destroyed them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be the same on the day the Son of Man is revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day, the person who is on the roof and has belongings in the house should not go down to get them. Likewise, the person in the field should not turn back for anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember Lot’s wife!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever tries to preserve his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life will keep it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you, on that night there will be two people in one bed. One will be taken, and the other will be left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will be two women grinding grain at the same place. One will be taken, and the other will be left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Where, Lord?” they asked him.
He said to them, “Where the corpse is, there the vultures will be gathered.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them a parable about the need to always pray and not lose heart:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There was a judge in a certain town who did not fear God and did not care about people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a widow in that town, and she kept going to him, saying, ‘Give me justice from my adversary!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For some time he refused, but after a while he said to himself, ‘Even though I do not fear God or care about people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet because this widow keeps bothering me, I will give her justice so that she will not wear me out with her endless pleading.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “Listen to what the unjust judge says.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will not God give justice to his chosen ones, who are crying out to him day and night? Will he put off helping them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you that he will give them justice quickly. However, when the Son of Man comes, will he find faith on the earth?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told this parable to certain people who trusted in themselves (that they were righteous) and looked down on others:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Two men went up to the temple courts to pray. One was a Pharisee, and the other was a tax collector.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisee stood and prayed about himself like this: ‘God, I thank you that I am not like other people, robbers, evildoers, adulterers, or even like this tax collector.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I fast twice a week. I give a tenth of all my income.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “However the tax collector stood at a distance and would not even lift his eyes up to heaven, but was beating his chest and saying, ‘God, be merciful to me, a sinner!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I tell you, this man went home justified rather than the other, because everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, but the one who humbles himself will be exalted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People were bringing even their babies to Jesus, so that he would touch them. When the disciples saw this, they began to rebuke them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus invited them, saying, “Let the little children come to me, and do not hinder them, for the kingdom of God belongs to such as these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amen I tell you: Whoever does not receive the kingdom of God like a little child will never enter it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A certain ruler asked Jesus, “Good teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus asked him, “Why do you call me good? No one is good, except one—God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know the commandments: ‘You shall not commit adultery. You shall not murder. You shall not steal. You shall not give false testimony. Honor your father and mother.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have kept all these since I was a child,” he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard this, he said to him, “You still lack one thing. Sell all that you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the ruler heard these words, he became very sad, because he was very rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw that the man became very sad, he said, “How hard it is for those who have riches to enter the kingdom of God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who heard this said, “Then who can be saved?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He replied, “What is impossible for people is possible for God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter said, “Look, we have left our possessions and followed you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Amen I tell you: Anyone who has left house or wife or brothers or parents or children for the sake of the kingdom of God
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: will most certainly receive many times more in this time, and in the age to come, eternal life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took the Twelve aside and said to them, “Look, we are going up to Jerusalem, and everything that is written through the prophets about the Son of Man will be accomplished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, he will be handed over to the Gentiles. They will mock him, mistreat him, spit on him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: flog him, and kill him. On the third day, he will rise again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did not understand any of these things. What he said was hidden from them, and they did not understand what was said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he approached Jericho, a blind man sat by the road, begging.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he heard a crowd going by, he asked what was happening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told him that Jesus the Nazarene was passing by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called out, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who were at the front of the crowd rebuked him, telling him to be quiet. But he kept calling out all the more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus stopped and ordered the man to be brought to him. When he came near, he asked him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What do you want me to do for you?”
He said, “Lord, I want to see again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Receive your sight. Your faith has saved you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately he received his sight and began following Jesus, glorifying God. All the people, when they saw this, gave praise to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus entered Jericho and was passing through.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man named Zacchaeus was there. He was a chief tax collector, and he was rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was trying to see who Jesus was, but since he was short, he could not see because of the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He ran on ahead and climbed up into a sycamore tree to see Jesus, because he was about to pass by that way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus came to the place, he looked up and said to him, “Zacchaeus, hurry and come down, for I must stay at your house today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came down quickly and welcomed Jesus joyfully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people saw it, they were all grumbling because he went to be a guest of a sinful man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zacchaeus stood up and said to the Lord, “Look, Lord, I am going to give half of my possessions to the poor. And if I have cheated anyone out of anything, I will pay back four times as much.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Today, salvation has come to this house, because he too is a son of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save the lost.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were listening to these things, Jesus went on to tell a parable, because he was near Jerusalem, and the people thought that the kingdom of God was going to appear at once.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said, “A man of noble birth traveled to a distant country to receive a kingdom for himself and then to return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called ten of his servants and gave them ten minas. ‘Conduct business until I return,’ he said to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But his subjects hated him and sent a delegation after him, saying, ‘We do not want this man to be king over us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When he returned after receiving the kingdom, he summoned the servants to whom he had given the money. He wanted to find out what they had gained by conducting business.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The first one came to him and said, ‘Master, your mina has earned ten more minas.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He said to him, ‘Well done, good servant! Because you were faithful in a very small matter, you will have authority over ten cities.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The second one came and said, ‘Master, your mina has produced five more minas.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So he said to him, ‘You will be over five cities.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And another one came and said, ‘Master, here is your mina that I laid away in a piece of cloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I was afraid of you, since you are a demanding man. You take what you did not deposit and reap what you did not sow.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He said to him, ‘You wicked servant, I will judge you with your own words! You knew that I am a demanding man, taking what I did not deposit and reaping what I did not sow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then why did you not put my money in the bank? Then, when I returned, I could have collected it with interest!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He said to those standing there, ‘Take the mina away from him and give it to the one who has the ten minas.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But they said to him, ‘Master, he already has ten minas!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘I tell you that to everyone who has, more will be given, but from the one who does not have, even what he has will be taken away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as for those enemies of mine who did not want me to be king over them, bring them here and kill them in front of me.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus had said these things, he went on ahead, going up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he came near to Bethphage and Bethany, at the place called the Mount of Olives, he sent two of his disciples ahead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Go to the village ahead of you. When you enter it, you will find a colt tied, on which no one has ever sat. Untie it and bring it here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if anyone asks you, ‘Why are you untying it?’ you will say this: ‘The Lord needs it.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who were sent ahead went and found things just as he had told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were untying the colt, its owners said to them, “Why are you untying the colt?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “The Lord needs it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they brought the colt to Jesus. They threw their robes on the colt and set Jesus on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he went along, people spread their robes on the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was approaching the slope of the Mount of Olives, the whole crowd of disciples began to praise God joyfully, with a loud voice, for all the miracles they had seen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Blessed is the King who comes in the name of the Lord! Peace in heaven and glory in the highest!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the Pharisees from the crowd said to him, “Teacher, rebuke your disciples!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He replied, “I tell you, if these people would be silent, the stones would cry out.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he came near, he saw the city and wept over it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “If you, yes you, had only known on this day the things that would bring peace to you. But now, it is hidden from your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, the days will come upon you when your enemies will build an embankment against you, surround you, and hem you in on every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Within your walls, they will dash you and your children to the ground. And within your walls, they will not leave one stone on top of another, because you did not recognize the time when God came to help you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus entered the temple courts and began to drive out those who were selling things there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “It is written, ‘My house will be a house of prayer,’ but you have made it a ‘den of robbers’!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every day he was teaching in the temple courts, but the chief priests, the experts in the law, and the leaders of the people continued to look for a way to put him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They could not find any way to do it, because all the people were clinging to him and listening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day, as Jesus was teaching the people in the temple courts and preaching the good news, the chief priests and experts in the law came to him with the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him, “Tell us by what authority you are doing these things. Or who is the one who gave you this authority?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “I will also ask you one question. Tell me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the baptism of John—was it from heaven or from men?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They discussed it with one another, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Why did you not believe him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we say, ‘From men,’ all the people will stone us, for they are convinced that John was a prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they answered that they did not know where it was from.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Neither am I going to tell you by what authority I am doing these things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He began to tell the people this parable: “A man planted a vineyard, leased it to some tenant farmers, and went away on a journey for a long time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was the right time, he sent a servant to the tenants to collect his share of the fruit of the vineyard. But the tenant farmers beat the servant and sent him away empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man went ahead and sent yet another servant, but they also beat him, treated him shamefully, and sent him away empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He then sent yet a third. They also wounded him and threw him out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The owner of the vineyard said, ‘What should I do? I will send my son, whom I love. Perhaps they will respect him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when the tenant farmers saw him, they talked it over with one another. They said, ‘This is the heir. Let’s kill him, so that the inheritance will be ours.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They threw him out of the vineyard and killed him. So what will the owner of the vineyard do to them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will come and destroy those tenant farmers and give the vineyard to others.”
When they heard this, they said, “May it never be!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he looked at them and said, “Then what about this that is written:
The stone that the builders rejected has become the cornerstone?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken to pieces, and it will crush the one on whom it falls.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That very hour the chief priests and the experts in the law began looking for a way to lay hands on him, because they knew he had spoken this parable against them. But they were afraid of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They watched him carefully and sent spies, who pretended to be sincere, so that they could trap Jesus in something he said, and then deliver him up to the power and authority of the governor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They questioned him, “Teacher, we know that you say and teach what is right and show no partiality to anyone, but you teach the way of God on the basis of the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it right for us to pay taxes to Caesar or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he was aware of their deceit and said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Show me a denarius. Whose image and inscription are on it?”
“Caesar’s,” they answered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Then give to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were not able to trap him in what he said in the presence of the people. They were amazed at his answer and became silent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the Sadducees (who say there is no resurrection) came to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him a question, “Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if a man’s brother dies leaving a wife but no children, his brother should take the wife and raise up children for his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there were seven brothers. The first took a wife and died childless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second took her as a wife,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and so did the third, and in the same way the seven died and left no children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally the woman died too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So in the resurrection, whose wife will she be? For the seven had her as a wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “The people of this age marry and are given in marriage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those who are considered worthy to experience that age and the resurrection from the dead neither marry nor are given in marriage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, they cannot die any more, for they are like the angels. They are sons of God, because they are sons of the resurrection.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Even Moses showed in the account about the burning bush that the dead are raised, when he called the Lord: ‘The God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living, for all are alive to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the experts in the law answered, “Teacher, you have spoken well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they no longer dared to ask him anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “How is it that they say that the Christ is David’s son?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David himself says in the book of Psalms:
The Lord said to my Lord,
“Sit at my right hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
until I make your enemies
a footstool under your feet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So David calls him ‘Lord.’ Then how is he his son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While all the people were listening, Jesus said to his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Beware of the experts in the law, who like to walk around in long robes and love greetings in the marketplaces, the best seats in the synagogues, and the places of honor at banquets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They devour widows’ houses and offer long prayers to look good. They will receive greater condemnation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked up and saw rich people putting their gifts into the offering box.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He saw a poor widow there putting in two small coins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Truly I tell you, this poor widow put in more than everyone,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for all these put in some of their leftovers as gifts to God, but she, out of her poverty, put in all that she had to live on.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As some were talking about the temple, how it was decorated with beautiful stones and offerings, Jesus said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These things that you see here—the days will come when there will not be one stone left on another—every one will be thrown down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him, “Teacher, when will these things happen? And what is the sign that these things are about to happen?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Watch out so that you are not deceived! For many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am he,’ and ‘The time is near.’ Do not follow them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever you hear of wars and revolutions, do not be terrified, for these things must happen first, but the end will not be right then.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will be great earthquakes, famines, and plagues in various places. There will be horrifying sights and great signs from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But before all these things, they will lay their hands on you and will persecute you, handing you over to synagogues and prisons, bringing you before kings and governors for my name’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will turn out to be your opportunity to testify.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So make up your minds not to prepare beforehand how to defend yourselves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I will give you words and wisdom that none of your adversaries will be able to withstand or contradict.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be betrayed even by parents, brothers, relatives, and friends. They will put some of you to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be hated by all people for my name’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But not a hair of your head will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By patient endurance you will gain your lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, then know that its desolation is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains. Let those who are inside the city get out. Let those who are in the country not enter the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For these are days of vengeance, to fulfill all that has been written.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How terrible it will be for those who are pregnant and nursing infants in those days! For there will be great distress in the land and wrath against this people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will fall by the edge of the sword and be taken captive to all nations. Jerusalem will be trampled on by Gentiles until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There will be signs in the sun, moon, and stars. And on the earth nations will be in anguish, in perplexity at the roaring of the sea and the surging waves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: people fainting from fear and expectation of the things coming on the world, for the powers of the heavens will be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when these things begin to happen, stand up and lift up your heads, because your redemption is near.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them a parable. “Look at the fig tree and all the trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as they are sprouting leaves, you can see for yourselves and know that summer is actually near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So also, when you see these things happening, know that the kingdom of God is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amen I tell you: This generation will not pass away until all these things happen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Watch yourselves or else your hearts will be weighed down with carousing, drunkenness, and the worries of this life, and that day may come on you suddenly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it will come like a trap on all those who dwell on the face of the whole earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stay alert all the time, praying that you may be able to escape all these things that are going to happen and that you may be able to stand before the Son of Man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During the days, Jesus was teaching in the temple courts, and each night he would go out and spend the night on the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people came early in the morning to listen to him in the temple courts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Festival of Unleavened Bread, which is called the Passover, was approaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests and the experts in the law were trying to find some way to put Jesus to death, because they were afraid of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Satan entered Judas, called Iscariot, who was one of the Twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went away and spoke with the chief priests and officers of the temple guard about how he could betray Jesus to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were glad and agreed to give him money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He promised to do it and was looking for an opportunity to betray Jesus to them away from the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The day of Unleavened Bread arrived, when it was necessary to sacrifice the Passover lamb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sent Peter and John, saying, “Go prepare the Passover for us, so that we may eat it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “Where do you want us to prepare it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “Just as you enter the city, a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him into the house that he enters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher says to you, “Where is the guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will show you a large, furnished upper room. Make preparations there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went and found things just as he had told them, and they prepared the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the hour had come, Jesus reclined at the table with the twelve apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “I have eagerly desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I tell you, I will not eat it again until it is fulfilled in the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took a cup, gave thanks, and said, “Take this and divide it among yourselves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I tell you, from now on I will not drink of the fruit of the vine until the kingdom of God comes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took bread, and when he had given thanks, he broke it and gave it to them, saying, “This is my body, which is given for you. Do this in remembrance of me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, he took the cup after the supper, saying, “This cup is the new testament in my blood, which is being poured out for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But look, the hand of him who is going to betray me is with mine on the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man is going to go as it has been determined, but woe to that man by whom he is betrayed!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began to discuss with one another which of them it was who was going to do this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A dispute arose among the disciples about which of them was considered to be greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he told them, “The kings of the Gentiles lord it over them, and those who have authority over them are called Benefactors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it is not to be that way with you. Instead, let the greatest among you become like the youngest, and the one who leads like the one who serves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For who is greater, one who reclines at the table or one who serves? Isn’t it the one who reclines at the table? But I am among you as one who serves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are those who have remained with me in my trials.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am going to grant a kingdom to you, just as my Father granted to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom. And you will sit on thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “Simon, Simon, pay attention: Satan has asked to have you all, so that he may sift you as wheat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I prayed for you, Simon, that your faith may not fail. And when you have returned to me, strengthen your brothers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, “Lord, I am ready to go with you both to prison and to death!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus replied, “I tell you, Peter, the rooster will not crow today until you deny three times that you know me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said to them, “When I sent you out without money bag, traveler’s bag, and sandals, did you lack anything?”
“Nothing,” they said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told them, “But now, let the one who has a money bag take it, and likewise a traveler’s bag. And let the one who has no sword sell his cloak and buy one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I tell you that this Scripture must be fulfilled in me: ‘He was counted with transgressors.’ Indeed, what is written about me is going to have its fulfillment.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said, “Lord, look, here are two swords.”
He said to them, “That is enough.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus left and went out to the Mount of Olives, as was his custom. His disciples followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he reached the place, he told them, “Keep praying that you may not enter into temptation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He withdrew from them about a stone’s throw, knelt down, and prayed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Father, if you are willing, take this cup away from me. Nevertheless, not my will, but yours be done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An angel from heaven appeared to him and strengthened him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was in agony, he prayed more fervently. His sweat became like great drops of blood falling to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he rose from prayer, he went to the disciples and found them sleeping as a result of sorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Why are you sleeping? Get up and keep praying so that you may not enter into temptation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking, suddenly a crowd appeared, and the man called Judas, one of the Twelve, was leading them. He came near to Jesus to kiss him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to him, “Judas, are you betraying the Son of Man with a kiss?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When those who were around him saw what was about to happen, they said to him, “Lord, should we strike with a sword?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of them struck the servant of the high priest and cut off his right ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus responded, “Stop! No more of this!” Then he touched the servant’s ear and healed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to the chief priests, the officers of the temple guard, and the elders, who had come out against him, “Have you come out as you would against a robber, with swords and clubs?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every day I was with you in the temple courts, and you did not lay hands on me. But this is your hour—when darkness rules.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they seized him, led him away, and brought him into the high priest’s house.
Peter followed at a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had lit a fire in the middle of the courtyard and sat down together, Peter sat down among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A servant girl saw him sitting near the light. She looked closely at him and said, “This man also was with him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he denied it, saying, “Woman, I do not know him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
After a little while someone else saw him and said, “You also are one of them!”
But Peter answered, “Man, I am not!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After about one hour had passed, someone else was firmly insisting, “Truly this man was with him too, because he is a Galilean!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said, “Man, I don’t know what you are talking about!” At that very moment, while he was still speaking, the rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord turned and looked at Peter. Then Peter remembered the Lord’s word, how he had said to him, “Before the rooster crows today you will deny me three times.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went outside and wept bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men who were holding Jesus in custody mocked him while they were beating him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They blindfolded him and kept asking him, “Prophesy! Who hit you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went on saying many other blasphemous things against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as it was day, the council of the elders of the people met together, both the chief priests and experts in the law. They brought him into their Sanhedrin and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If you are the Christ, tell us.”
But he said to them, “If I tell you, you will not believe,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if I ask you, you will not answer me or release me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But from now on, the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the power of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They all said, “Are you then the Son of God?”
He said to them, “I am what you are saying.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said, “Why do we need any more testimony? For we ourselves have heard it from his own mouth!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole group of them got up and brought him before Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began to accuse him, saying, “We found this fellow misleading our nation, forbidding the payment of taxes to Caesar, and saying that he himself is Christ, a king.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate asked him, “Are you the King of the Jews?”
“It is as you say,” Jesus replied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said to the chief priests and the crowds, “I find no basis for a charge against this man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
