verses.text: But they kept insisting, “He stirs up the people, teaching all through Judea, beginning from Galilee all the way here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate heard this, he asked if the man was a Galilean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he learned that he was under Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, who was also in Jerusalem during those days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Herod saw Jesus, he was very glad. For a long time, he had wanted to see him, because he had heard many things about him. He hoped to see some miracle performed by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He questioned him with many words, but Jesus gave him no answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests and the experts in the law stood there, vehemently accusing him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod, along with his soldiers, treated him with contempt and ridiculed him. Dressing him in bright clothing, he sent him back to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod and Pilate became friends with each other on that day. Before this they had been enemies of each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate called together the chief priests, the rulers, and the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “You brought this man to me as one who is misleading the people. Look, I have examined him in your presence. I have found in this man no basis for the charges you are bringing against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod did not either, for he sent him back to us. See, he has done nothing worthy of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will have him flogged and release him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate needed to release one prisoner to them at the Festival.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they all shouted together with one voice: “Take him away! Release Barabbas to us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Barabbas had been thrown in prison for a rebellion in the city and for murder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate addressed them again, because he wanted to release Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they kept shouting, “Crucify! Crucify him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them the third time, “Why? What evil has he done? I have found no grounds for sentencing him to death. So I will whip him and release him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they kept pressuring him with loud voices, demanding that he be crucified. And their voices were overwhelming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate decided that what they demanded would be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He released the one they had asked for, who had been thrown in prison for rebellion and murder, but he handed Jesus over to their will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they led him away, they seized Simon of Cyrene, who was coming from the country. They placed the cross on him and made him carry it behind Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A large crowd of people was following him, including women who were mourning and wailing for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus turned to them and said, “Daughters of Jerusalem, stop weeping for me, but weep for yourselves and for your children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be sure of this: The days are coming when they will say, ‘Blessed are the childless women, the wombs that never gave birth, and the breasts that never nursed.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will begin to say to the mountains, ‘Fall on us!’ and to the hills, ‘Cover us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if they do these things to the green wood, what will happen to the dry?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two other men, who were criminals, were led away with Jesus to be executed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the place called The Skull, they crucified him there with the criminals, one on his right and the other on his left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing.”
They cast lots to divide his garments among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people stood watching. The rulers were ridiculing him, saying, “He saved others. Let him save himself, if this is the Christ of God, the Chosen One!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers also made fun of him. Coming up to him, they offered him sour wine,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “If you are the King of the Jews, save yourself!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was also an inscription written above him: “This is the King of the Jews.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the criminals hanging there was blaspheming him, saying, “Aren’t you the Christ? Save yourself and us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the other criminal rebuked him. “Don’t you fear God, since you are under the same condemnation?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are punished justly, for we are receiving what we deserve for what we have done, but this man has done nothing wrong.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Jesus, remember me when you come in your kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Amen I tell you: Today you will be with me in paradise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was now about the sixth hour, and darkness came over the whole land until the ninth hour,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while the sun was darkened. Then the curtain of the temple was torn in two.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus cried out with a loud voice, “Father, into your hands I commit my spirit!” When he had said this, he breathed his last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the centurion saw what had happened, he began to glorify God, saying, “This man really was righteous.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the groups of people who had gathered to see this spectacle saw what had happened, they returned home beating their chests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those who knew Jesus, and the women who followed him from Galilee, stood at a distance, watching these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a man named Joseph, from the Jewish town of Arimathea, who was a member of the Council, a good and righteous man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had not agreed with their plan and action. He was looking forward to the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man went to Pilate and asked for Jesus’ body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took it down, wrapped it in a linen cloth, and placed it in a tomb that was cut out of rock, where no one had yet been laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was Preparation Day, and the Sabbath was beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The women who had come with Jesus from Galilee followed after Joseph, and they observed the tomb and how his body was laid there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they returned and prepared spices and perfumes. On the Sabbath they rested according to the commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day of the week, very early in the morning, the women went to the tomb, carrying the spices they had prepared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They found that the stone had been rolled away from the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they went in, they did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were wondering about this, suddenly two men stood by them in dazzling clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The women were terrified and bowed down with their faces to the ground.
The men said to them, “Why are you looking for the living among the dead?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not here, but has been raised! Remember how he told you while he was still in Galilee
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the Son of Man must be delivered over to the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they remembered his words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they returned from the tomb, they told all these things to the Eleven and to all the rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and the other women with them who told these things to the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet these words seemed to them like nonsense, and they did not believe them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter got up and ran to the tomb. Bending over to look in, he saw only the strips of linen cloth. He went home, amazed at what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, on that same day, two of them were going to a village named Emmaus, about seven miles from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were talking with each other about all of these things that had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were talking and discussing this, Jesus himself approached and began to walk along with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But their eyes were kept from recognizing him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “What are you talking about as you walk along?” Saddened, they stopped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them, named Cleopas, answered him, “Are you the only visitor in Jerusalem who does not know the things that have happened there in these days?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What things?” he asked them.
They replied, “The things concerning Jesus of Nazareth, a man who was a prophet, mighty in deed and word before God and all the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests and our rulers handed him over to be condemned to death. And they crucified him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we were hoping that he was going to redeem Israel. Not only that, but besides all this, it is now the third day since these things happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also some women of our group amazed us. They were at the tomb early in the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they did not find his body, they came back saying that they had even seen a vision of angels, who said that he was alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of those who were with us went to the tomb. They found it just as the women had said, but they did not see him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “How foolish you are and slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did not the Christ have to suffer these things and to enter his glory?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then beginning with Moses and all the prophets, he explained to them what was said in all the Scriptures concerning himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they approached the village where they were going, he acted as if he were going to travel farther.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they urged him strongly, saying, “Stay with us, since it is almost evening, and the day is almost over.”
So he went in to stay with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he reclined at the table with them, he took the bread, blessed it, broke it, and began giving it to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly their eyes were opened, and they recognized him. Then he vanished from their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to each other, “Were not our hearts burning within us while he was speaking to us along the road and while he was explaining the Scriptures to us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They got up that very hour and returned to Jerusalem. They found the Eleven and those who were with them assembled together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were saying, “The Lord really has been raised! He has appeared to Simon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They themselves described what had happened along the road, and how they recognized him when he broke the bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were talking about these things, Jesus himself stood among them and said to them, “Peace be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were terrified and frightened and thought they were looking at a ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Why are you troubled? Why do doubts arise in your hearts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look at my hands and my feet. It is I myself. Touch me and see, because a ghost does not have flesh and bones as you see that I have.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they still did not believe it (because of their joy), and while they were still wondering, he said to them, “Do you have anything here to eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave him a piece of broiled fish and some honeycomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took it and ate in front of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “These are my words that I spoke to you while I was still with you: Everything must be fulfilled that is written about me in the Law of Moses, the Prophets, and the Psalms.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he opened their minds to understand the Scriptures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “This is what is written and so it must be: The Christ will suffer and rise from the dead on the third day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and repentance and forgiveness of sins will be preached in his name to all nations, beginning from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are witnesses of these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, I am sending you what my Father promised. But stay in the city until you are clothed with power from on high.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He led them out as far as the vicinity of Bethany. He lifted up his hands and blessed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while he was blessing them, he parted from them and was taken up into heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they worshipped him and returned to Jerusalem with great joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were continually in the temple courts, praising and blessing God. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
